newsitem.title: ROMANIA: BUCHAREST FIRST TIER IN LIMELIGHT BUT MOSTLY FLAT.
newsitem.headline: BUCHAREST FIRST TIER IN LIMELIGHT BUT MOSTLY FLAT.

text.p: The Bucharest bourse's first
tier, which has been taking strong volumes since the start of
the year, maintained command of the market on Friday,
accounting for around 89 percent of turnover.
But share prices of three of the four heavyweights remained
unchanged, as they held to a resistance level.
"High-caps had drifted rather high and buyers continued to
show reluctance to pay more," a broker said.
He said he expected first-tier stocks to ease down next
week, also on profit-taking.
First-tier chemical plants Azomures and Oltchim,
as well as pharmaceuticals company Terapia
marked time at closes of 3,700, 2500 and 6,000 lei
respectively. The other pharmaceuticals firm Antibiotice
moved lower 350 lei to end at 5,750.
Turnover was 6.54 billion lei, down from 8.14 billion the
previous day.
The second tier featured lacklustre trading, with a bright
spot from Policolor dye maker, which had more than
355 million lei in turnover and closed 100 lei firmer at 4,200.
Seven second-tier stocks had no trade and three were
suspended pending release of their 1996 results.
Two unofficial bourse indices, the VAB and the BIG, drifted
higher by 2.5 and 2.45 percent respectively from the previous
session. The BIG first-tier index rose by 3.74 percent to
3,381.49 points.
MAY 9 MAY 8 Week's change 1997 high 1997 low
NOTE - * The bourse had no session last Friday.
-- Luli Popescu, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
